entry.content:
I Current available and useful dataset links

  1. Original dataset: Initial dataset presentation (Kaggle)
  2. Supplementary dataset:
    • DEMOGRAPHIC AND SOCIO-ECONOMIC (UNESCO) dataset
    • COVID19-government-measures-dataset
    • COVID19_Global_Weather_Data

II Some of my ideas (Combining feedback from the mentor)

We discussed, and here I wrote some analysis plans that we have not decided yet and would like to ask mentor’s opinion.

We consider that each country will show different growth trends when responding to the virus due to differences in population, economy, medical level, etc. And we temporarily consider dividing the analysis into two parts.

Part1: Analysis based on time series data and other fixed factors

We define: growth = the number of new cases per day, multiples = new cases in today/new cases in previous day.

Step1: Looking for the trends of various countries from the time series data.
Since only time series data is provided, I first observed the curve of the number of new cases per day and the multiple of the previous day in Italy.

We can find:

1. The histogram of daily new case can be divided into 3 stages: rapid growth period A, stable period B, and decline period C.

2. The red curve shows that the vibrations around 1 are gradually flattening( tendency ), and may show short-term periodicity (observe the 5 dashed boxes, but this is not certain)
Notice: Since most other countries are still in stage A, I cannot make more observations. For China, the division of the three stages is obvious, but the change of the multiple is more complicated.

Assuming the above observations are universal, perhaps we can obtain quantitative description of the curve in the following ways:

  • A. Based on histogram, set multiple threshold to divide into 3 stages and compute these variables for three stages respectively : the number of days, the number of cumulative cases,the average of daily new cases……..etc.

  • B. For the red curve:
    In time series analysis, we always divide a series($S$) into three parts: trend($T$), periodicity($P$), and noise($E$). And $S=T+P+E$.

    We found a special pca method for time series that can be used to extract trends and periodicities,which is called singular spectrum analysis(SSA). Here is wiki link and an example:

    Description and example(from page 30 in slides): https://www.slideshare.net/IsabelMagalhes13/some-contributions-to-pca-for-time-series
    Wiki: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Singular_spectrum_analysis

Step2: Clustering the countries according to the quantitative description of the curve.

Step3: Analyze the growth performance of countries under different cluster;
Using tools such as correlation coefficients , ANOVA to find the factors that have a significant impact on growth from the supplementary data of population, national age distribution, hospital beds, economic level, etc;
Analyze the commonalities of the countries in a single group.

Step4: If everything goes well, maybe we can make some predictions using methods such as LR or time series analysis(ARIMA…).

Question: We are not sure whether this plan is effective and meaningful. So we want to ask the opinion of mentor,especially about SSA.

Part2: Consider building SIR models, but I don’t have much idea about it now.

Questions:

  1. Evaluate a SIR model for every country as mentor suggested, however this seems like a huge amount of work to do for every country.
  2. SIR is an infectious disease model without any restrictions. Suppose we obtained a prediction curve from SIR, we are not sure how to use it to get some useful conclusions?

entry.title: Statistics - Learning Path 统计学习路径
entry.content:
I Prerequisites：Probability and Inferential Statistics

1 Course: MIT Probabilistic Systems Analysis and Applied Probability(概率分析及应用)

01/03/2020 - 20/03/2020

Bilibili中字课程,not include seminar/tutoria：https://www.bilibili.com/video/av39034423?p=17
Bilibili原版课程,including seminar/tutoria：https://www.bilibili.com/video/av39034423?p=17

以下大多内容根据自己需要整理自谭升的博客https://face2ai.com/math-probability-big-picture/　　

1.1 Basic Concept

试验 Experiments

An experiment is any process,real or hypothetical,in which the possible outcomes can be identified ahead of time.

real: 丢硬币，结果可能是正面，反面，或者立着

hypothetical: 有一个不能立起来的硬币

样本空间 Sample Space

The collection of all possible outcomes of an experiment is called the sample space of experiment

样本点 Point: 每一个outcome可以成为一个样本点(Point或者Element)

事件，随机事件，偶然事件 Events

An event is a well-defined set of possible outcomes of the experiment

  • 衍生出不可能事件和必然事件
  • 样本空间的子集
  • 全部的样本点组成了样本空间，部分样本点组成了事件，和容易判定的一个关系。

概率 Probability

A probability measure ,or simply a probability,on a sample space S is a specification numbers Pr(A) for event A that satisfy of Kolmogorov Axioms 1,2 and 3

Axioms 1: 对于任意事件A：$Pr(A)\geq1$
Axioms 2: 必然要发生的事件的概率是1
Axioms 3: 对于无限不向交事件序列$A_1,A_2,A_3,…$那么：$Pr( \bigcup\limits_{i=1}^\infty A_i)=\sum\limits_{i=1}^\infty Pr(A_i)$

概率论现在研究以及以后都要研究的重点，也是概率论最核心的问题！

  1. 已知一个试验的所有输出及其概率，我们要确定一个方法来计算某个事件的概率。
  2. 当得到附加的信息后如何调整修正当前事件的概率

1.4 Sample Statistics

1.4.7 条件期望(Conditional Expectation)

Def: Let X and Y be random variables such that the mean of Y exists and is finite.The conditional expectation(or conditional mean) of Y given X=x is denoted by E(Y|x) and is defined to be the expectation of the conditional distribution of Y given X=x.

1.3

1.3.1 Random Variables and Discrete Distributions

随机变量

Definition Random Variables:Let S be the sample space for an experiment.A real-valued fuction that is defined on S is call a random variable
随机变量的分布
Definition Ditribution :Let X be a random variable.The distribution of X is the collection of all probabilities of the form Pr(X∈C) for all sets C of real numbers such that X∈C is an event

1.6 Large Random Samples

例子引入：
Example 1 :　扔硬币100次，50次正面朝上的事件发生概率仅有0.0796，但是放宽为区间40-60 次正面朝上的事件发生概率高达0.9648．
Example 2 : 一个队列的客户，第 i 个客户在队列中等待 Xi 其是随机变量，假设 X1,X2,… 是i.i.d的，其是 [0,1] 上的均匀分布，等待的期望是 0.5，所以当用户样本数量足够大的时候这些样本的均值越接近0.5 。但是多个样本的均值的分布其实是很复杂的，可能没办法准确的描述多个样本的均值与0.5的接近程度。

大数定理(LLN)会给出数学基础来证明一些随机变量的大量样本的均值，接近于他们的期望。
中心极限定理(CLT)来给出样本的均值来近似期望的概率。

4Logistic regression and lin-ear discriminant analysis.
5Cross-validation and the bootstrap
6A host of linear methods:stepwise selection, ridge regression, principal components regression, partial least square, lasso
7non-linear methods that work well for problems with a single input variable.And how these methods can be used to fit non-linear additive models for which there is more than one input.
8tree-based methods, including bagging, boosting,a n drandom forests.
9Support vector machines, a set of approaches for performing both linear and non-linear classification
10consider a setting in which we have input variables but no output variable.PCA,K-means,hierarchical clustering

II Applied Statistics 2020.03-2020.06

1.1 Overview 0-25min 需要回顾

1) 探索多元数据集：描述性统计数据和图形显示。多元样本的几何形状。广义方差。协方差矩阵导出的度量。
Exploring a multivariate dataset: descriptive statistics and graphical displays. The geometry of a multivariate sample. Generalized Variance. The metric induced by the covariance matrix.

2) 数据表示和降维：协方差结构分析，主成分分析。独立成分分析。
Data representation and dimensional reduction: the analysis of the covariance structure, principal component analysis. Independent component analysis.

3) 关于平均向量的推论：$Hotelling T^2$检验。置信区域和分量均值的同时比较。Bonferroni方法可进行多次比较。
Inferences about a mean vector:$Hotelling T^2$test. Confidence regions and simultaneous comparisons of component means. The Bonferroni method for multiple comparisons.
家庭错误率和错误发现率。几种多元均值的比较。方差分析和MANOVA。线性模型的推论。
Familywise Error Rate and False Discovery Rate. Comparisons of several multivariate means. ANOVA and MANOVA. Inference for Linear Models.
超越最小二乘法：岭回归，套索，正则化最小二乘。广义线性模型简介。
Beyond Ordinary Least Squares: ridge regression, lasso, regularized least Squares. Introduction to generalized linear models.

4) 区分，分类，聚类。统计分类：模型，分类错误成本和先验概率。
Discrimination, classification, clustering. Statistical classification: model, misclassification costs and prior probability.
贝叶斯监督分类和Fisher方法进行判别分析。
Bayesian supervised classification and the Fisher approach to discriminant analysis.
分类的替代方法：逻辑回归，CART。相似性度量。无监督分类；分层和非分层方法。多维缩放。
Alternative approaches to classification: logistic regression, CART. Similarity measures. Unsupervised classification; hierarchical and nonhierarchical methods. Multidimensional scaling.

5) 统计学习的进展：功能数据分析。数据平滑，降维和表示。功能主成分分析。数据记录：相位和幅度可变性。功能数据分类。
Advances in Statistical Learning: Functional Data Analysis. Data smoothing, dimensional reduction and representation. Functional principal component analysis. Data registration: phase and amplitude variability. Classification of functional data.

6) 统计学习的进展：空间数据。随机字段，方差图模型和方差图拟合。空间预测和Kriging，具有空间依赖性的功能数据。
Advances in Statistical Learning: spatial data. Random fields, variogram models and variogram fitting. Spatial prediction and Kriging, Functional data with spatial dependence.

回音法介绍https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/31760454
1.把整段影片扫过一次
